channel.title: nlin.SI updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: nlin.SI updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On vector Schwarz-KdV equation
item.description: arXiv:2509.03155v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A collection of miscellaneous continuous, semi-discrete, and discrete integrable systems can be associated with each integrable evolution equation of the KdV type. We give them for the Schwarz-KdV equation and generalize to the vector case. The existence of these vector generalizations is a non-trivial experimental fact, any mathematical explanation of which is not yet known.
item.dc:creator: M. Balakhev, V. Sokolov

item.title: Long time asymptotics for the KPII equation
item.description: arXiv:2509.02907v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The long-time asymptotics of small Kadomtsev-Petviashvili II (KPII) solutions is derived using the inverse scattering theory and the stationary phase method.
item.dc:creator: Derchyi Wu

item.title: Global variants of $\mathcal{N}=1^*$ theories and Calogero-Moser systems
item.description: arXiv:2504.01502v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Global variants of four-dimensional gauge theories are specified by their spectrum of genuine Wilson-'t Hooft line operators. The choice of global variant has significant consequences when spacetime is taken to be $\mathbb{R}^3 \times S^1$. We focus on $\mathcal N=1^*$ theories, which are closely connected to twisted elliptic Calogero-Moser systems. We establish, on general grounds, how this gauge-theoretic topological data manifests itself on the integrable system side by introducing a notion of global variants for complex many-body integrable systems associated with Lie algebras. Focusing on $\mathcal N=1^*$ theories of type $A$ and $B_2$, we elucidate the implications for the structure of gapped vacua, the emergent (generalized) symmetries realized in each vacuum, and the action of spontaneously broken modular invariance.
item.dc:creator: Jerem\'ias Aguilera Damia, Riccardo Argurio, Antoine Bourget, Valdo Tatitscheff, Romain Vandepopeliere
